title: Model-Based Inquiry Projects for Middle School Students' Understanding of Molecular Biology and Genetics

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment for undergraduate sociology majors to explore molecular biology and genetics concepts by applying them to real-life and societal issues.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the process by which genes act as instructions for protein synthesis at the molecular level.
The intermediary role of proteins in the gene expression process can be analyzed in connection with social phenomena (e.g., debates on gene-editing technology).
New genetic phenomena can be designed using model-based inquiry methods, and experimental results can be interpreted to assess social impact.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
